models.name: Monotype
models.job_desc:
1. Scope



 

Our finance department is looking for a Co-Op/Intern to join the royalty and revenue team to assist with their daily operations.Â  This role will not only aid the team with their day to day responsibilities, but will also work with the team to make processes more efficient. This is a great opportunity to combine financial, analytical and systems thinking collaboratively across the finance department.

 

    1. Responsibilities



 


    • Revenue Operations

        • Review, reconcile and validate the accuracy of customers royalty reporting

        • Understand the terms of licensing agreements to efficiently analyze compliance contracts

        • Process related information needed to create invoice to customer

        • Respond to internal inquiries regarding contracts, reports and other general inquires







    • Royalty Operations

        • Process and initiate work-flow for new or updated royalty calculations in the royalty reporting system

        • Review, reconcile and validate the accuracy of Licensor royalty reports

        • Post invoices for accounts payables

        • Respond to inquiries from external partners regarding royalty related matters




 


    • Project Management (Depending on company status and workload)

        • Support finance department with projects that could be unique to a department in finance or can be collaborations with other finance team members






    1. Requirements






    • 0-1 years of experience in a Business, Accounting or Finance role preferred

    • Proficiency in Excel, and the capacity to learn and master new software applications

    • Experience with financial software/systems e.g. SAP, Alliant etc. is a plus, but not required

    • Experience working with databases and generating reports is a plus, but not required

    • Organization skills and the ability to balance multiple responsibilities

    • Detail and deadline orientation

    • High level of motivation, and willingness to take initiative and ask questions

    • Interest in learning and developing new skillsets

    • Desire to make the most out of this opportunity

    • Progress towards a degree in finance or accounting

models.name: Apple
models.job_desc:
***

Please apply both here and through the job link below

https://jobs.apple.com/en-us/details/200320784/ios-or-macos-software-engineer-iwork?team=SFTWR

***

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. 

Are you interested in creating amazing user experiences on iOS, iPadOS, and macOS with a friendly and inclusive team? Apple’s iWork team is looking for a passionate engineer to bring their unique perspective and join us in building world-class apps used by millions of people to get things done at home, in their communities, and in their jobs every day.

Key Qualifications

  • Experience writing software in Swift, Objective-C, C++, or C with experience on Apple platforms preferred
  • Solid understanding of object-oriented design
  • Willingness to ask for help, learn from others, and mentor others in turn
  • Ability to work collaboratively to improve designs and code
  • Proficiency at communicating ideas clearly within a team and with outside collaborators

Description

In this role you will help craft new and innovative features in Keynote, Numbers, and Pages, and take existing features to the next level. You’ll contribute to every facet of our large, sophisticated codebase, from high-level UI to low-level data management. You will work with human interface designers, quality assurance teams, and other cross functional teams to go beyond code and will influence everything from user interface to project planning. Along with collaborating within iWork, you’ll have a chance to work with other groups at Apple to prove and adopt upcoming features and abilities in our platforms.

We’ll trust you to work with your teammates to come up with the best solutions to technical problems and drive their adoption, and to make use of and create new tools and processes to help make sure everything you build meets our goals for quality.
models.job_title: iOS or macOS Software Engineer - iWork

models.name: Apple
models.job_desc:
***

Please apply both here and through the job link below

https://jobs.apple.com/en-us/details/200254988/software-engineer-web-iwork?team=SFTWR

***

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. ** We are hiring in Vancouver, WA, Pittsburgh, PA, Cupertino, CA and Vancouver, Canada ** Are you interested in creating amazing user experiences on the Web with a friendly and inclusive team? Apple’s iWork team is looking for a passionate engineer to bring their unique perspective and join us in building world-class apps used by millions of people to get things done at home, in their communities, and in their jobs every day.

Are you interested in creating amazing user experiences on the Web with a friendly and inclusive team? Apple’s iWork team is looking for a passionate engineer to bring their unique perspective and join us in building world-class apps used by millions of people to get things done at home, in their communities, and in their jobs every day.

Key Qualifications

  • Solid understanding of JavaScript frameworks and the challenges in the space, preferably with advanced usage of at least one of React, Angular, Vue.js, or SproutCore.
  • Ability to learn and quickly work with new and unfamiliar technologies.
  • Solid understanding of object-oriented design.
  • Ability to work collaboratively and communicating ideas clearly within a team and with outside stakeholders.

Description

In this role you will help us craft new and innovative features in Keynote, Numbers, and Pages, and take existing features to the next level. You’ll contribute to every facet of our large, sophisticated codebase, from high-level UI to backend integration with Apple's infrastructure. You will work with human interface designers, or site reliability engineers, or quality assurance teams, and teams in other disciplines to go beyond code and bring your ideas to life.

The ideal candidate is pragmatic, self-motivated, thoughtful individual with a strong desire to learn and develop technical expertise in a wide array of technologies. iWork engineers have exposure to nearly every technology available on Apple’s platforms, get to ship code targeting many of our products, and get to learn from experienced engineers. You’ll be trusted to work with various teams to come up with the best solutions to technical problems and drive their adoption.

models.job_title: iOS or macOS Software Engineer - iWork

models.name: Hasbro, Inc.
models.job_desc:
After submitting your resume on NUworks, you also need to click “Apply On Website” and submit your application on Hasbro's career portal. Your application will only be considered if you've applied in both places.

Start/End Dates

  • The ideal student can begin work between June 10 and June 17 and end their co-op experience between January 6 and 13.
  • A later start date and earlier end date may be considered.

Hybrid Work

  • Co-ops have the opportunity to work in-person 2-3 days/week and work remotely the other 2-3 days. Commuting is a breeze: Hop on the Commuter Rail at Ruggles and take the train to Attleboro Station where we offer a complementary shuttle to our facility.

Job Description

Hasbro is currently seeking an enthusiastic, proactive, and curious Global Logistics Co-Op to operate under the close supervision of a Senior Analyst or Manager. In this role, you will gain exposure to a dynamic business environment where you will be able to apply classroom skills to real life supply chain situations. The overall experience will increase your knowledge of the global supply chain of a consumer product. The Global Logistics Department has an extensive network of partners that support the various subgroups of the Department. Get ready to be involved in the continuous interaction and coordination among internal and external stakeholders including Transportation providers for Domestic and International shipments, Customs Brokers, Vendors, Booking Agents, Affiliate Markets and Warehouses, globally.

A Day in the life of a Global Logistics Co-op...

For Hasbro's Transportation and Warehousing Teams, Global and U.S. Domestic Transposition, roles and responsibilities include analyzing shipment data, performing mode/carrier selection, container utilization, shipment tracking and the measurement of carrier performance. We are responsible for ensuring that Hasbro is compliant with all applicable transportation laws and regulations. Working within SAP and Oracle Transportation Management you will manage transportation activity from planning to execution. The team is responsible for all U.S. ground transportation and works closely with trucking providers and domestic customers to ensure on-time delivery. The team works cross-functionally with U.S. Warehouses, Account Support and Customer Compliance to investigate problems, identify root causes and develop solutions on domestic shipments.

As part of the Global Trade Compliance Team responsible for the adherence to all applicable trade laws and regulations, part of your role will be to help classify Hasbro products under the U.S. Harmonized Tariff Schedule and issues U.S. Certificates of Origin for qualifying shipments to Affiliate markets. The team analyzes and tracks global duty spend and utilization of Free Trade Agreements. They work cross-functionally with Hasbro brand teams, as well as global commercial markets and their corresponding customs brokers to ensure global partners are in compliance with Hasbro policies & procedures.

What you'll bring...

  • Working towards a degree in Business, Finance, Supply Chain, Operations or similar. Relevant supply chain or business internship experience preferred.
  • Ability to work full time from June- December, 2022.
  • Desire to adapt and learn, embracing Hasbro’s core values of Passion, Integrity, Creativity and Community.
  • Ability to maintain effective working relationships through teamwork and leadership skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, reasoning and organization skills.
  • Willingness to take initiative; developing processes and reports relating to the Hasbro business.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.

models.name: Hasbro, Inc.
models.job_desc:
After submitting your resume on NUworks, you also need to click “Apply On Website” and submit your application on Hasbro's career portal. Your application will only be considered if you've applied in both places.

Start/End Dates

  • The ideal student can begin work between June 10 and June 17 and end their co-op experience between January 6 and 13.
  • A later start date and earlier end date may be considered.

Hybrid Work

  • Co-ops have the opportunity to work in-person 2-3 days/week and work remotely the other 2-3 days. Commuting is a breeze: Hop on the Commuter Rail at Ruggles and take the train to Attleboro Station where we offer a complementary shuttle to our facility.

    Job Description

    The Global Supply Chain Planning Co-Op operates under the close supervision of a Sr. Global Planner or Planning Manager. The position provides real world experience in consumer-packaged goods and upon successful completion of the role, the Co-Op will be able to successfully plan inventory and capacity in a global environment.

    He/She balances global supply with global demand as provided by the commercial markets around the world, planning inventory and executing procurement/production orders for his/her assigned brand(s) against a market level phased demand forecast. The Co-Op creates feasible supply plans that meet minimum order quantities while recognizing and communicating the impact of constrained capacity on demand, dynamically allocating production to 26+ global warehouses. The Co-Op analyzes and communicates supply and demand disconnects in a phased inventory environment, identifying any new product development risks/gaps, suggesting appropriate action plans, and requesting that The Sourcing Entity and vendors develop corrective service options as necessary. Past brands planned by Co-Ops include Disney Princess, NERF, My Little Pony, and Play-Doh and responsibility level can be as high as $100M of inventory purchase value. 

    The Co-Op will learn real world application of SAP's newest software, Integrated Business Planning and will form partnerships in North America, South America, Asia, Europe and Australia. The position carries the same responsibilities and expectations of a full-time role that a graduating student would fill, giving the incumbent valuable and practical experience that will strengthen their candidacy for full time employment with Hasbro or other consumer products companies.  

    Education 

    • Working towards a degree in Business, Finance, Supply Chain, Operations or similar. Relevant supply chain or business internship experience preferred. 

    Knowledge/Skills: 

    • Desire to adapt and learn, embracing Hasbro’s core values of Passion, Integrity, Creativity and Community. 
    • Ability to maintain effective working relationships through teamwork and leadership skills. 
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, reasoning and organization skills. 
    • Willingness to take initiative; developing processes and reports relating to the Hasbro business. 
    • Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.

models.name: Hasbro, Inc.
models.job_desc:
Animatronics Co-op

Hasbro is currently recruiting enthusiastic, technically curious & creative engineering students for our Advanced Technology and Innovation (ATI) team.  This group researches & presents relevant new technologies for future Hasbro products.  Engineers evaluate competitive products & participate in product brainstorming sessions.  Actively participate on cross functional project teams throughout development lifecycle, provides technical advice & feasibility assessment for new concepts and define product gameplay (flow charts & robotic routines) & program concept/development models.

We also offer a unique opportunity to our students by participating in Hasbro’s Co-op EPIC group project. Co-ops work in teams to bring an idea for a Hasbro product to concept stage. This includes presenting the idea to business partners at various checkpoints in the process and prototyping the concept for presentation.

  • Build, assemble, and debug proof of concept breadboard models & prototypes
  • Collaborate w/ internal partners & outside vendors to develop new mechanisms & technologies
  • Create SolidWorks models for rapid-prototyping
  • Work on every aspect of the product development process, Design, Engineering, Gameplay, Aesthetics, Programming, and audio

Qualifications:

  • Must be a current undergraduate or graduate student
  • Must be available to work full-time as a co-op from July- December 2022
  • Co-op assignment can be either a mandatory or optional requirement for graduation
  • Preference will be given to candidates with:
  • Completion of at least one year of study towards a BS in Mechanical Engineering
  • Project work or co-op experience in product design engineering, mechanism design
  • CAD, Design, Machining, Prototyping, Programming
  • Excellent communication & interpersonal effectiveness skills
  • Strong time/project management skills & the desire to build/expand competency in this area
  • Intermediate-level skills in MS Excel, Word & Outlook & web-based applications

Must be currently enrolled in undergrad or graduate level courses.  

Candidates are responsible for their own housing & transportation (FREE Parking).  Hasbro headquarters in Pawtucket, RI is 1.3 mi from the South Attleboro, MA commuter rail station 

Hasbro (NASDAQ: HAS) is a global company committed to Creating the World’s Best Play Experiences, by leveraging its beloved brands, including LITTLEST PET SHOP, MAGIC: THE GATHERING, MONOPOLY, MY LITTLE PONY, NERF and TRANSFORMERS, and premier partner brands. From toys and games, television programming, motion pictures, digital gaming and a comprehensive lifestyle licensing program, Hasbro fulfills the fundamental need for play and connection for children and families around the world. The Company’s Hasbro Studios creates entertainment brand-driven storytelling across mediums, including television, film and more. Through the company's commitment to corporate social responsibility, including philanthropy, Hasbro is helping to build a safe and sustainable world and to positively impact the lives of millions of children and families every year. Learn more at www.hasbro.com and follow us on Twitter (@Hasbro & @HasbroNews)

models.name: Hasbro, Inc.
models.job_desc:
At Hasbro, we’re changing the face of play and entertainment! We’re looking for people who want to explore, experiment, and innovate to come up with the best ideas. Our culture of Community, Passion, Integrity, Creativity, and Inclusion has inspired our diverse team of highly skilled, highly creative, and highly committed individuals for 90+ years and we believe the best is yet to come.

Product Engineer Co-op:

 

Hasbro is currently recruiting hardworking, technically curious & creative engineering students to assist Engineers & Project Managers in the development of our products. You will learn how a toy is developed from initial concept in the U.S. to production overseas. Depending on education level, increasing experience & proven track record, there will be opportunities to assume independent project &/or product design responsibility.  

 

We also offer a unique opportunity to our students by participating in Hasbro’s Co-op EPIC group project. Co-ops work in teams to bring an idea for a Hasbro product to concept stage. This includes presenting the idea to business partners at various checkpoints in the process and prototyping the concept for presentation. 

 

A day in the life of a Product Engineering Co-op....

 

Product Development Engineering 

  • Work with Development teams to ensure quality, cost and schedule alignment.
  • Assist Engineers during concept development, prototyping, product testing, and manufacturing debug
  • Provide technical advice and feasibility assessment for new product concepts 
  • Connect with multi-functional teams (Marketing, Design, Project Management, Packaging, Quality, Legal, and Hasbro Far East Engineers) on product content issues throughout the entire development process.
  • Build product specification packages (using Excel, Word and our web-based product development system) to define product content and functionality, including cost and delivery targets
  • Participate in cost review and reduction efforts to meet business objectives
  • Build, assemble, test, and debug proof of concept breadboard models & prototypes using SolidWorks and rapid-prototyping 
     

What you'll bring...

 

  • Must be a current undergraduate or graduate student. Students graduating in May of 2022 are NOT eligible for fall 2022 co-op opportunities. 
  • Must be available to work full-time as a co-op from July- December 2022
    Co-op assignment can be either a mandatory or optional requirement for graduation
  • Completion of at least one year of study towards a BS in Mechanical Engineering or Industrial Engineering
  • Project work or co-op experience in product design engineering, mechanism design
  • Excellent communication & interpersonal efficiency skills 
  • Strong time/project management skills & the desire to build/expand competency in this area 
  • Experience with Photoshop, Illustrator
  • Working knowledge of SolidWorks and/or Pro-E
  • Intermediate-level skills in Microsoft O365
  • The love of play is an absolute must! 
     

The ideal candidate can provide projects or products via an online portfolio/links/attachments showing solid work, product development or creative projects outside of school. 

 

Candidates are responsible for their own housing & transportation (FREE Parking). Hasbro headquarters in Pawtucket, RI and offers complimentary shuttle service to and from the Attleboro commuter rail station. 

 

Hasbro is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. We are committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status.

models.name: IFactory Inc.
models.job_desc:
iFactory isn't just a company, but a closely-knit team that wants you to join our community. Our co-ops aren't looked at as temporary employees, but assets to our team whose impact will continue to mold our processes and informal culture.

As a co-op, you won't be expected to do "intern work" like making copies or grabbing coffees, but you'll engage with clients on a weekly basis and contribute to our deliverables and workflows. This will leave you with portfolio pieces that can land you other future co-ops and full-time positions when the time comes.


 

Do you have a passion for designing accessible, modular, beautiful websites, and apps? Are you a self-starter hungry for experience? Then we want to meet you. At iFactory, you will learn from a team of talented designers, information architects, strategists, and developers working on projects in higher education, non-profit, publishing, healthcare, and startups. We believe design co-ops should have creative control over their work and interact directly with clients to solve problems, not simply follow directions.


As the Interactive Design co-op, your daily tasks include but are not limited to:

  • Work as part of the design team to understand iFactory's process and assist with creative and administrative functions.
  • Develop the look and feel of sites using common design tools
  • Design screen-based, multi-device experiences under the mentorship of a senior designer.
  • Present your work to clients and get feedback.
  • Work with developers to ensure your designs are executed properly.

Skills you should be comfortable with include:

  • Strong graphic design portfolio
  • Excellent grasp of typography, color, imagery, and composition
  • Holistic perspective and eye for detail
  • Ability to come up with Big Ideas
  • Fluency in design software
  • Comfort presenting and taking feedback
  • Interest in usability, interaction design, and mobile experiences
  • Motivation and passion and desire to learn from others and improve your craft

No prior web design experience is necessary -  you will learn on the job.

For safety reasons, the co-op is currently remote, but if the situation changes please note we are conveniently located just steps from the Downtown Crossing and Park Street T stations, we are Boston's premier website redesign agency working for high-profile clients such as MIT and Harvard.

If you're considering this option among a few others, our weekly catered lunches will surely seal the deal. As for the rest of the week, we are a quick commute from Northeastern's campus, and in the epicenter of Boston's food hub with hundreds of restaurants and cafes all within a five-minute walk from our office.



RDW Group, Inc./iFactory is an Equal Opportunity Employer



An online portfolio is required for this position. Please include the link in your resume.

models.name: Adapt Agency
models.job_desc:
Our team is looking for a motivated and passionate individual to support our UX practice. You’ll work to optimize our users’ experience and turn insights into engaging, actionable recommendations that make a difference for our clients.


This is an opportunity to work with a highly collaborative team, leveraging a variety of methodologies to envision, evaluate, and create innovative design solutions. You will be contributing to a number of website projects on an ongoing basis. You will be tasked with overcoming complicated user challenges and transforming them into meaningful and critical experiences.


Adapt is a global digital marketing agency, with a diverse set of clients across a wide range of industries. This will be an opportunity to gain real world experience on a multitude of content management systems and unique projects. 

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct interviews and other research to understand users’ needs, pain-points, and attitudes regarding web design
  • Prepare interview scripts and survey questions
  • Produce user stories, wireframes, and clickable prototypes
  • Oversee usability testing with users (remotely and/or in person)
  • Compile and review research results and key findings
  • Make actionable recommendations based on research findings
  • Communicate research insights and recommendations to team members and clients in an effective manner
  • Engage frequently with Adapt team to gain insight into project management, web development, and business practices at a digital marketing agency

What we are looking for:

  • Passion for research-fueled rapid ideation
  • Strong grasp of human-centered design principles and best practices
  • An understanding and appreciation for accessibility for the web
  • Ability to work independently in a dynamic and collaborative environment
  • Excellent organization, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills
  • A foundation in qualitative and quantitative research methods
  • Comfort with interviewing and observing users across a range of roles and environmental conditions
  • A digital portfolio or sample PDF demonstrating an ability to think from the perspective of the user

models.name: Greene Naftali
models.job_desc:
FINANCE ASSOCIATE One of New York’s leading contemporary art galleries is seeking an energetic, responsible, self-motivated professional to fill a full-time position as Finance Associate.

Founded in 1995 in the historic Chelsea neighborhood in Manhattan, Greene Naftali Gallery represents an international roster of artists who have exhibited worldwide in the most prestigious museums, including The Museum of Modern Art, New York, The Centre Pompidou, Paris, The Tate, London and The Samsung Museum of Art, Seoul. Our program reflects a forward view on culture with both young artists and estates.

The Finance Associate will work with the oversight of the Associate Director and work closely with the full-time offsite bookkeeper to assist with managing the gallery’s finances. The Finance Associate will also work in tandem with department heads and sales directors to steward payables and invoicing. The successful candidate will exhibit professionalism while handling vital business activities with competing deadlines and changing priorities. They will be an active problem-solver and critical thinker who excels in a highly dynamic work environment and has an outstanding attention to detail. This is a unique opportunity with significant potential for growth for a motivated individual to gain invaluable experience in small business and art world finance at a gallery with high value, low volume transactions.

KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: - Oversee majority of Accounts Payable, including vendors and donations - Organize and track the aging of payables and timing of payments - Create invoices for artworks and non-artwork expenses, working with gallery Directors to invoice clients - Steward the gallery’s revenue streams by tracking and pursuing Accounts Receivable - Daily communication with offsite bookkeeper and CPA to ensure proper recording of all gallery activities, including AP and AR, short-term and long-term liabilities - Assist with monthly review and close of books, working with full-time offsite bookkeeper to cross check gallery’s internal record keeping with QuickBooks, managed by bookkeeper - Act as liaison to gallery’s PEO, including processing bimonthly payroll, processing new hires and terminations, and ensuring gallery employee files are updated - Track and record production and exhibition costs in gallery inventory system for individual artworks and for shows, working with Sales Directors, Artist Liaisons, and Production Manager - Assist with managing foreign currency accounts and payments - Oversee gallery credit cards and staff expenses, manage monthly credit card audits - Liaise with vendors and clients on finance-related matters - Calculate and track sales commissions for gallery Directors and external associates - Maintain gallery manual of all finance processes and practices - Process payments to 1099 employees and gallery interns - Manage benefits enrollment for new hires - Assist with yearly benefits renewal for all staff

QUALIFICATIONS - Bachelor’s degree or higher - Focus or minor in accounting, business management, or economics preferred - Two to four years of full-time work experience in business finance, experience in small business preferred - Experience in art world preferred but not required - Demonstrated experience in bookkeeping and data entry - Proficiency with QuickBooks - Proficiency with Microsoft Excel - Proficiency with ArtBase a plus - Experience working with PEOs a plus - Outstanding attention to detail

This is a full-time, in-person position. Qualified candidates should submit a resume, cover letter, contact information for three references, and salary requirements to jobs@greenenaftaligallery.com.
models.job_location: New York, New York, United States

models.name: Playa Society
models.job_desc:
Playa Society is a fast-growing streetwear brand looking for an MVP Brand and Business Manager who is resourceful, outgoing, and thinks outside of the box. If you’re a good teammate, organized, and loves story-telling, keep reading!


WHAT (the role)

  • Become an expert on Playa Society products, brand, and community
  • Build the foundation of our start-up team as an integral teammate, with responsibilities that can be determined by your core strengths. We want you to grow with us!
  • Build authentic relationships with our digital community and partners

HOW (the responsibilities)

  • Scheduling: meetings, appointments, events, and conferences
  • Relationship management: maintain contact lists, provide customer service, follow-up with inquiries, connect with Playa Society partners and athletes; explore and nurture new business opportunities.
  • Project Management: assist with project research and manage timelines
  • Additional responsibilities based on core strengths may include assisting with product design, e-commerce management, or content marketing management.

WHO (the person we're looking for)

  • The ideal candidate will have 1-2 years experience in Retail/Apparel, Product Design, or Project Management
  • Great interpersonal skills
  • Women's Sports Knowledge
  • Streetwear/Sportswear Interest preferred

models.name: Hasbro, Inc.
models.job_desc:
Do you have a passion for data? We are growing our Analytics team! We have an opportunity available for a Data Engineer Intern who will work with partners in IT and across the organization to enable data-driven decisions. This person's main responsibility will be to expand the usable pool of data available for conducting analysis. They will also help execute the roadmap for Analytics within Hasbro and scope, plan, and execute strategic Analytics projects to help Hasbro’s brands achieve profitable growth!

 

A day in the life as a Data Engineer Intern (under the direction of the Principal Data Engineer):

 

Partner with peer coaches on developing data pipelines to ingest, clean, and prepare data for analysis. Develop views and aggregated datasets that can be easily loaded into analytical tools.
Partner with business resources to gather business requirements, conduct testing sessions and conduct demos of solutions.
Support analytics projects and conduct analysis. Leverage descriptive and exploratory techniques, text analytics, and statistical methods to help answer business questions. Prepare results and communicate findings to stakeholders. Projects may be small, one-time requests or larger, ongoing programs.
 

What you'll bring:

 

Pursuing a degree in a quantitative field (e.g., comp sci, engineering, economics), advanced degree/MBA a plus.
Intermediate experience with a scripting language like Python (preferred), R, Scala, C#, UNIX shell, etc.
Intermediate SQL skills, ability to design and optimize queries and create data structures.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills – will gain experience working with business stakeholders and senior leaders.
Strong time management capabilities with the ability to communicate status and issues on tasks to team and leadership.
Professionalism and strong focus on customer.

models.name: Tech Target
models.job_desc:
Technology Writer

TechTarget's Content Innovation editorial group is a welcoming, hard-working team that prioritizes excellence and opportunities to learn from each other. Our mission is to create and maintain an archive of educational content that is compelling for a mixed readership of IT professionals, business professionals, and the general public. We are expanding our in-house writing staff and seek a Technology Writer.

The Technology Writer will work with a small team focused primarily on TechTarget's flagship technology encyclopedia site, WhatIs.com. Duties will be focused mainly on revising existing technology explainer articles, bringing them in line with our current quality guidelines and meeting search discoverability recommendations. This often means rewriting entire articles.

The ideal candidate will have a love of writing, ability to be prolific, and strong interest in learning about information technology disciplines such as security, cloud computing, software development and IT infrastructure, as well as software platforms and applications used by business professionals. The ability to research these areas, synthesize information, and write about it clearly will be essential.

The Technology Writer will also be expected to learn about search engine optimization and be willing and able to integrate SEO research and tools into their writing process as needed. At the same time, their content must stay true to editorial goals and ethics.

Attention to detail and deadlines, strong organizational skills and flexibility are essential to success in this role.


Essential Job Functions

·        Write technology explainer articles for an IT and business professional audience

·        Produce clear, easy-to-read copy

·        Research and learn about coverage areas through reading and interviewing expert sources

·        Fact check and ensure technical accuracy of content

·        Collaborate with TechTarget editors on requested edits and revisions

·        Work up to producing two to three articles each week

·        Learn about SEO and competitor research

·        Use SEO guidance and best practices in content while emphasizing editorial integrity

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Required

·        One to two years of experience writing about technology

·        A demonstrated understanding of writing and journalism ethics

·        Willingness to learn SEO concepts and apply tools and research to writing

·        Ability to produce multiple articles each week on deadline

·        Bachelor’s degree in journalism, English, or a technical field

·        Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Remote candidates will be considered.

models.name: Hasbro, Inc.
models.job_desc:
At Hasbro, we’re changing the face of play and entertainment! We’re looking for people who want to explore, experiment and innovate to come up with the best ideas. Our culture of Community, Passion, Integrity, Creativity and Inclusion has inspired our diverse team of highly skilled, highly creative and highly committed individuals for 90+ years and we believe the best is yet to come. 


Under supervision from the Hasbro Senior Research Scientist and Chemist, we are seeking a Chemistry co-op to support the Chem Lab Team with formulating new compounds, performing incremental changes on existing compounds and characterize compounds thermally, spectroscopically and theologically. Additionally, the Chemistry Co-Op will assist in the design of experiments to address compound performance, reliability, and regulatory compliance. You will also participate in professional development and team building exercises. 


A day in the life of a Chemistry Lab Co-op:  

Develop a basic understanding of the product development process 
Participate in team meetings 


Understand regulatory and industry requirements as they apply to chemicals in toys 

Understand the principals behind rheological, spectroscopic and thermal analysis measurements 


Interact daily with Quality Assurance, Design and Development and Marketing team(s) 


Assist with bench work and testing of new formulas as well as help maintain lab organization and maintenance 


Assist in the data collection and review to prepare submissions as required under Federal/state chemical reporting regulations. 


Participate in Hasbro’s Engineering Product Innovation Co-op Challenge (EPIC Challenge). This is an annual event where co-ops work in teams to bring an idea for a Hasbro product to concept stage. This includes presenting the idea to business partners at various checkpoints in the process and prototyping the concept for presentation. 


What you'll bring: 
Must be a current undergraduate or graduate student with a focus on Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or a similar field. 2021 or earlier graduates are not eligible for our Co-op program 


Must be available to work full-time and onsite from July- December 2022

Co-op assignment can be either a mandatory or optional requirement for graduation 


Excellent communication & interpersonal efficiency skills 


Strong time/project management skills & the desire to build/expand competency in this area. 


Candidates are responsible for their own housing & transportation (FREE Parking). Hasbro headquarters in Pawtucket, RI is 1.3 mi from the South Attleboro, MA commuter rail station and we offer shuttle service.

models.name: Hasbro, Inc.
models.job_desc:
We are looking for team members who are detail oriented, fearless collaborators, and hungry to gain experience and develop their talents.  

As the Inventor Relations and Fun Lab Co-Op, you will be embedded in two dynamic teams, working directly with both internal teams and the public.  You will work hands-on as a full team member: 
Communicating with external partners 
Managing concept assets  
Actively supporting play testing  
Aiding Fall Expo prep and execution  
Actively supporting internal concept reviews  
 
 
A DAY IN THE LIFE AS AN INVENTOR RELATIONS CO-OP: 
Actively participate in fall event prep and associated inventor meetings 
Manage innovation models and assets: tracking location, ensuring functionality, and facilitating timely internal review. 
Maintain brand relationship document, update details as well as layout 
Effectively utilize resources and time management skills to manage projects and meet deadlines 
Build confidence and knowledge when interacting with internal / external partners and presenting design solutions.  
  
A DAY IN THE LIFE AS A FUNLAB CO-OP: 
Recruit the best-matched children/families qualified to participate in Funlab Research sessions. Manage database updates. 
Interact maturely with consumers of all ages; be well spoken, remain personable, and provide a positive Funlab experience.  
Conduct tech checks with all participants prior to VIRTUAL research sessions.  Confirm participants can log in via TEAMS, ensure audio and video are working on mobile device/computer, check internet connectivity and answer questions prior to the live sessions.  
Operate video equipment to record live streaming research sessions, capturing important design learnings/happenings.  
Extrapolate information gathered in research sessions, incorporating the design objective under focus. 
 
WHAT YOU’LL BRING: 
Be a current undergraduate or graduate student enrolled in a degree program. 
Proven time management skills. 
Enthusiasm for detail-oriented project work  
Ability to comfortably communicate by phone, by email, and in-person in a clear and comfortable fashion. 
Proven ability to work independently and jointly; accepting direction as well as capable of managing own time and deadlines. 
 
 
You are responsible for their own housing & transportation (FREE on-site parking).  Hasbro headquarters is in Pawtucket, RI which is 1.3 mi from the South Attleboro, MA commuter rail station.
models.job_title: Inventor Relations/ Fun Lab Split Co-op

models.name: Internships Down Under
models.job_desc:
Group Co-op Program in Sydney, Australia  

 

Program Description



Northeastern is offering, for the first time, a new exciting way of thinking about global co-ops.   The cohort co-op program offers a powerful combination of experiential education in a group setting. Celebrate your unique professional experience abroad with the support of your Husky friends. 

 

For program details and application process see below - application deadline extended to April 30, 2022.



Benefits to students


    • Cohort model: travel, live and work abroad with other students
    • Interdisciplinary: share professional experiences in global work environments with peers from other colleges 
    • Inclusive: planning details will be managed by a local provider and established Northeastern partner (Internships Down Under)
    • Financial support for the program will be available from various NU sources 


Why Sydney? 

 

Sydney is Australia's largest and most famous city.  Think of the World Heritage-listed Sydney Opera House and its ingenious shape and the impressive steel arch of the Harbour Bridge.  The blue waters of the harbor and the white sands and curling waves of Bondi Beach will also come to mind.  These beautiful images inspire people from all over the world to visit Sydney.  This beautiful, cosmopolitan city celebrates its cultural diversity and heritage, and passion for arts and sports. (www.sydney.com)

 

 

Examples past placements and roles 

 

Todae Solar - Engineering

Founded in 2003, Todae Solar is Australia-owned #1 commercial and industrial solar EPC with strong local-knowledge and experience.  Our company ethos is rooted in sustainability which has been recognized by the City of Sydney and NSW Government with awards.  It takes an innovative team to achieve this success and our employees are front and center.  Together we work hard, we laugh a lot, we collaborate non-stop and we support each other.

 

Accor Hotels - Marketing, finance, media & communications, social entrepreneurship

We are far more than a worldwide leader.  We are 280,000 hospitality experts placing people in the heart of what we do and nurturing real passion for service and achievements beyond limits.  We take care of millions of guests in our 4,900 addresses.

 

Stone & Chalk - Computer Science

Stone and Chalk first opened its doors in 2015 as the only dedicated fintech hub in Australia.  Today, we are focused on the industries of tomorrow, as the proliferation of new innovation pours into everything from insurance to agriculture, science to space.  We have a vibrant community made up of startups, banks, corporates, regulators mentors and investors who all come together to create a melting of opportunity achieved through the perfect mix of innovation and collaboration.



Kokoda Track Foundation   Human rights, gender studies, international affairs

Our purpose: "we work with people and communities to improve the lives and futures of Papua New Guineans. We do this by assisting remote and rural communities with access to elementary and primary education, improving access to quality and accessible healthcare, improving livelihoods and access to sustainable income-generation opportunities, especially for women and by fostering the next generation of leaders"

 

Eastside FM Radio - journalism, communications, music

Eastside Radio is a community radio system based in Paddington, Sydney, and broadcasting to the eastern suburbs and the greater Sydney area, where it can heard as far west as the Blue Mountains.

 

UNSW Research - Environmental and conservation field research

The University of New South Wales is one of Australia's leading research and teaching universities. At UNSW we take pride of the broad range and high quality of our teaching programs.  Our research activities, strong industry links and our international nature, along with our regional and global engagement gives strength and currency to our research activities.

 

NSW Department of Education - Nursing and health sciences

Under the many services of NSW Department of Education is the Wellbeing Framework that supports schools to create learning environments that enable students to be healthy, happy, engaged and successful.  The Framework includes a variety of health organizations.

 

Note 1:  due to local employment laws these co-ops are unpaid

Note 2: Student interviews with employers will be arranged by the agency partner (Internships Down Under) only.

 

About Internships Down Under

 

A Northeastern partner, Internships Down Under, became the new operating name of Sydney Internships in 2013. First established in 2004 to provide a comprehensive service to international students wanting to complete an internship in Sydney, their services has expanded over the years to include all major cities throughout Australia.  The Northeastern progam will operate only in Sydney at this time.



Cost  and Living Expenses



Start Date           Duration          Fee    (1USD=1.46AUD)                                          

July 2022            24 weeks          $1650 AUD approx. $1205    



Fee inclusions

 

    • Your professional co-op
    • Airport Transfer Return
    • Insurance (12 weeks) (additional +$20 per week) $50 Pre-Paid Public Transport Card
    • Pre-Departure Information
    • Arrival orientation
    • Social meetings
    • Regular internship check-in
    • Ongoing support throughout program facilitator University/College Requirements





Housing Accommodations 

 

Option 1-Homestay (1USD=1.46AUD) - Meals and Internet included - Cost per week


2 meals Mon - Fri / 3 meals Weekends (Traditional) $320
1 meal (Dinner) x 7 days $295
No Meals  $250
3 meals x 7 days $350


Option 2 - Furnished Accommodation (1USD=1.46AUD) -   No meals - Cost per week

 
Property: Forest Lodge
Summary: King/twin rooms with shared bathroom and kitchen
Max Occupancy: 2
Rates: $500 per room/per week


Property: Jack`s Place
Summary: Single rooms with shared bathroom and kitchen         Max Occupancy: 1                                                                 Rates: $380 per room/per week


Property: Railway Studios
Summary: King/twin bed studio with kitchenette and ensuite bathroom. The room also counts with air conditioner, dining table, sofa                                                                         Max Occupancy: 2                                                           Rates: $590 per room/per week


Property: Wentworth Park
Summary: 2 bedroom apartment with a fully equipped kitchen, air conditioner, internal laundry, dishwasher
Max Occupancy: 4
Rates: $1,170 per room/per week

Northeastern and External Funding

Presidential Global Scholarship

Office of Undergraduate Research and Fellowships (research co-ops)

Global Experience Office

Employer Engagement and Career Design


Events & Cultural Immersion 

 

A full calendar of social and cultural events will be planned throughout the internship. Events have different costs, please review on agency website.

    • Weekend Trips
    • Social Meetings
    • Welcome Week Sydney


Pre-departure Orientation 

 

1. One month prior to their internship start date, interns are provided with information on the following

  • Welcome adventure week (optional)
  • Tips from previous interns
  • Confirmation of internship details
  • Information for the first day & what to expect
  • Intern WhatsApp Group links
  • Medical information & procedure
  • Budgeting information
  • Essential phone numbers
  • Public transport information
  • General safety tips 

2. Additionally, a group pre-departure orientation session via Skype will be organized and attended by Northeastern staff.  All students accepted to Internships Down Under will have to attend.

 

On-the-ground Orientation

 

The above is reinforced in a face to face orientation meeting. Host companies are guided through an induction checklist which they must take the interns through on their first day.


Emergency Assistance 


Please see our Health, Safety and Emergency Support site for further information. Available through your Co-op Coordinator.

 

Application Process

Students interested in the program should submit their resume to Aspa Papanastasiou at EECD for initial screening a.papanastasiou@northeastern.edu

  • Students are advised to apply for the Presidential Global Scholarship immediately
  • Once accepted to the program, students will be referred to IDU for intake and employment placement
  • Student completes the intake and pays the program deposit
  • Students interview with posted employers or similar
    Agency confirms student placement and provides necessary documentation 
  • Student accepts offered position and pays program fee 
    IDU staff coordinates visa guidance with NU Global Experience Office  
  • IDU suggest recommended arrival dates in conjunction with EECD 
  • Students book flights to Sydney
  • Students attend pre-departure orientation with agency and Northeastern staff 
  • Students attend on-the-ground orientation in Dublin
    Students continue to check in IDU until the end of their co-op
     



      Program Details 

        • The starting and end dates of this group co-op program are set  
        • Once you accept a position you make a commitment to this program 
        • All inclusives are part of the program cost 
        • Your participation to the Pre-Departure Orientation and On-the-Ground Orientation is mandatory 
        • Your participation to the cultural events is recommended but optional
        • All placements abroad are unpaid due to visa regulations   



      Student Testimonials


      Anna "It was a wonderful experience with the opportunity to not only learn new things but also to meet a lot of new and really nice people."

      You may find more testimonials on agency website.


      Where you can find more information 

        • Your Co-op Coordinator 
        • Aspa Papanastasiou @ EECD

models.name: Interiology Design Co.
models.job_desc:
The Interior Designer is the creative force that turns ideas into reality. You understand the architectural design process and how to integrate interior design concepts. You partner with clients and team members to develop and execute unique, creative designs that enhance the function and overall aesthetic of client spaces. You create designs and source products that are custom-tailored to each client’s unique specifications and then you make them real. 

WHAT YOU DO — CREATE & COLLABORATE


Big Picture

First, you collaborate with clients to understand their needs, desires and personal style. You learn about the people using the space and their goals.
Then, you collaborate with team members from the firm to develop creative, exciting design concepts and solutions to meet client needs.
You partner with clients from beginning to end and help guide them through the entire process, form general concept development to choosing final designs and layouts, to selecting products and details that bring your designs to life.

Day to Day

Manage multiple projects of various sizes, keeping track of all details and deadlines.
Prepare design packages to present high level concepts and detailed plans and product information to clients for approval. Prepare project cost estimates for client review and approval.
Review design and construction documents and specifications, including plans, elevations, furniture specifications and finishes that can be used for ordering and communicating with contractors, workrooms and vendors.
Meet regularly with team members to review project timelines, financial details and overall project progress.
Coordinate project details with contractors and service providers, including site visits to review work and progress.
Source and sell products to clients that are consistent with their project needs and budget requirements, keeping in mind the company’s financials goals.
Perform field measurements and photography; supervise installations and deliveries on site.


WHO YOU ARE & WHAT YOU BRING

You love interior design and bring together color, texture, form and style to create beautiful, functional spaces for clients.
You can communicate the intent of designs visually and verbally.
You love meeting new people and developing long-term relationships with clients, vendors and your peers in the firm.
You are highly self confident and comfortable working and selling in the luxury space.
You are superbly organized and have rigorous attention to detail.
You have strong interpersonal, negotiation and conflict management skills, particularly when working with clients. 
You know your way around a computer. You have strong proficiency with basic document, spreadsheet, presentation and file storage applications. Experience with Chief Architect and/or Design Manager is a plus but not required.
You are a college graduate with internship experience working in the interior design field. A degree or certificate in Interior Design or Kitchen and Bath Design is preferred.

Part-time position with full-time equivalent salary starting at $80,000 (actual compensation based on experience). No benefits.

models.name: Hasbro, Inc.
models.job_desc:
Design Engineer Co-op

Hasbro is currently recruiting enthusiastic, technically curious & creative engineering students to assist Engineer Managers in the development of our products. You will learn how a toy is developed from initial concept in the U.S. to production overseas.

We also offer a unique opportunity to our students by participating in Hasbro’s Co-op EPIC group project. Co-ops work in teams to bring an idea for a Hasbro product to concept stage. This includes presenting the idea to business partners at various checkpoints in the process, and prototyping the concept for presentation.

Product Development Engineering

  • Build, assemble, test, and debug proof of concept breadboard models & prototypes
  • Collaborate w/ internal partners & outside vendors to develop new mechanisms & technologies
  • Create SolidWorks models for rapid-prototyping
  • Provide technical advice and feasibility assessment for new product concepts
  • Communicate with cross functional teams (Marketing, Design, Project Management, Quality, Legal, and Hasbro Far East Engineers) on product content issues throughout the prototyping and development process
  • Research, develop, and test new projectiles

Qualifications: Must be a current undergraduate or graduate student studying Mechanical

  • Must be available to work full-time as a co-op 
  • Co-op assignment can be either a mandatory or optional requirement for graduation

Preference will be given to candidates with:

  • Completion of at least one year of study towards a BS in Mechanical Engineering
  • Samples of product design engineering, mechanism design (please include in your application)
  • Experience with Photoshop, Illustrator
  • Working knowledge of SolidWorks and/or Pro-E
  • Excellent communication & interpersonal effectiveness skills
  • Strong time/project management skills & the desire to build/expand competency in this area

The ideal candidate can provide projects or products via an online portfolio/links/attachments showing solid work, product development or creative projects outside of school.

Must be currently enrolled in graduate or undergraduate college courses. 

Candidates are responsible for their own housing & transportation (FREE Parking).  Hasbro headquarters in Pawtucket, RI is 1.3 mi from the South Attleboro, MA commuter rail station and we offer shuttle service. 

Hasbro (NASDAQ: HAS) is a global company committed to Creating the World's Best Play Experiences, by leveraging its beloved brands, including LITTLEST PET SHOP, MAGIC: THE GATHERING, MONOPOLY, MY LITTLE PONY, NERF, PLAY-DOH and TRANSFORMERS, and premier partner brands. From toys and games, television programming, motion pictures, digital gaming and consumer product licensing, Hasbro fulfills the fundamental need for play and connection with children and families around the world. The Company's Hasbro Studios and its film label, ALLSPARK PICTURES, create entertainment brand-driven storytelling across mediums, including television, film, digital and more. Through the company's commitment to corporate social responsibility, including philanthropy, Hasbro is helping to build a safe and sustainable world and to positively impact the lives of millions of children and families. Learn more at www.hasbro.com, and follow us on Twitter (@Hasbro & @HasbroNews) and Instagram (@Hasbro).
